verses.verse: (For the choir director; on stringed instruments. A Maskil of David.) Give<WH238> ear<WH238> to my prayer,<WH8605> O God;<WH430> And do not hide<WH5956> Thyself from my supplication.<WH8467>
Give<WH7181> heed<WH7181> to me, and answer<WH6030> me; I am restless<WH7300> in my complaint<WH7879> and am surely<WH1949> distracted,<WH1949>

Because<WH4480> of the voice<WH6963> of the enemy,<WH340> Because<WH4480> <WH6440> of the pressure<WH6125> of the wicked;<WH7563> For they bring<WH4131> down<WH4131> trouble<WH205> upon me, And in anger<WH639> they bear<WH7852> a grudge<WH7852> against<WH7852> me.
My heart<WH3820> is in anguish<WH9123> within<WH7130> me, And the terrors<WH367> of death<WH4194> have fallen<WH5307> upon me.
Fear<WH3374> and trembling<WH7461> come<WH935> upon me; And horror<WH6427> has overwhelmed<WH3680> me.
And I said,<WH559> "Oh,<WH4310> <WH5414> that I had<WH5414> wings<WH83> like a dove!<WH3123> I would fly<WH5774> away<WH5774> and be at rest.<WH7931>
"Behold,<WH2009> I would wander<WH5074> far<WH7368> away, I would lodge<WH3885> in the wilderness.<WH4057> Selah.<WH5542>
"I would hasten<WH2363> to my place<WH4655> of refuge<WH4655> From the stormy<WH5584> wind<WH7307> [and] tempest.<WH5591>"
Confuse,<WH1104> O Lord,<WH136> divide<WH6385> their tongues,<WH3956> For I have seen<WH7200> violence<WH2555> and strife<WH7379> in the city.<WH5892>
Day<WH3119> and night<WH3915> they go<WH5437> around<WH5437> her upon her walls;<WH2346> And iniquity<WH205> and mischief<WH5999> are in her midst.<WH7130>
Destruction<WH1942> is in her midst;<WH7130> Oppression<WH8496> and deceit<WH4820> do not depart<WH4185> from her streets.<WH7339>

For it is not an enemy<WH340> who reproaches<WH2778> me, Then I could bear<WH5375> [it]; Nor<WH3808> is it one who hates<WH8130> me who has exalted<WH1431> himself against<WH5921> me, Then I could hide<WH5641> myself from him.
But it is you, a man<WH582> my equal,<WH6187> My companion<WH9017> and my familiar<WH3045> friend.<WH3045>
We who<WH834> had<WH4985> sweet<WH4985> fellowship<WH5475> together,<WH9191> Walked<WH1980> in the house<WH1004> of God<WH430> in the throng.<WH7285>
Let death<WH4194> come<WH5378> deceitfully<WH5378> upon them; Let them go<WH3381> down<WH3381> alive<WH2416> to Sheol,<WH7585> For evil<WH7451> is in their dwelling,<WH4033> in their midst.<WH7130>
As for me, I shall call<WH7121> upon God,<WH430> And the Lord<WH3068> will save<WH3467> me.
Evening<WH6153> and morning<WH1242> and at noon,<WH6672> I will complain<WH7878> and murmur,<WH1993> And He will hear<WH8085> my voice.<WH6963>
He will redeem<WH6299> my soul<WH5315> in peace<WH7965> from the battle<WH7128> [which is] against me, For they are many<WH7227> [who strive] with me.

God<WH410> will hear<WH8085> and answer<WH6030> them – Even the one who sits<WH3427> enthroned<WH3427> from of old<WH6924> – Selah.<WH5542> With whom<WH834> there<WH369> is no<WH369> change,<WH2487> And who do not fear<WH3372> God.<WH430>
He has put<WH7971> forth<WH7971> his hands<WH3027> against those who<WH7965> were at peace<WH7965> with him; He has violated<WH2490> his covenant.<WH1285>

His speech<WH6310> was smoother<WH9140> than<WH4480> butter,<WH4260> But his heart<WH3820> was war;<WH7128> His words<WH1697> were softer<WH7401> than<WH4480> oil,<WH8081> Yet they were drawn<WH6609> swords.<WH6609>
Cast<WH7993> your burden<WH3053> upon the Lord,<WH3068> and He will sustain<WH3557> you; He will never<WH3808> <WH5769> allow<WH5414> the righteous<WH6662> to be shaken.<WH4131>

But Thou, O God,<WH430> wilt bring<WH3381> them down<WH3381> to the pit<WH875> of destruction;<WH7845> Men<WH376> of bloodshed<WH1818> and deceit<WH4820> will not live<WH2673> out half<WH2673> their days.<WH3117> But I will trust<WH982> in Thee.
